title: First all-female spacewalk to happen this month
text:
NASA has announced that the first all-female spacewalk has been scheduled for October 21. It was initially scheduled to take place in March, but was scrapped then due to availability issues of spacesuits.



This news came as part of the agency’s briefing which offered a preview of 10 upcoming spacewalks on the International Space Station. Astronauts Christina Koch and Jessica Meir will be taking the mission.



Koch is scheduled to conduct several other walks in October apart from the all-female one. She is already on the International Space Station since March 14, and is slated to stay there until February 2020. This makes her time on the station the longest single spaceflight by a woman.

According to the announcement, the 10 spacewalks are scheduled over the next three months.

Meir has also shared an image of hers with Koch on the space station.

This is how it feels when in addition to your childhood dream being fulfilled by arriving to @Space_Station, you’re greeted by your Astro-brothers and sisters on the other side of the hatch. pic.twitter.com/mexDxMdWhd — Jessica Meir (@Astro_Jessica) September 29, 2019

The two have trained together for the last six years.
description: The spacewalk, initially scheduled in March this year, was scrapped due to spacesuits availability issues.
